front.title: Path QoS Collection for RSVP-friendly Hop-by-hop QoS Routing

abstract.t: QoS routing needs some stabilization mechanism to prevent a delayed negative feedback on the link QoS information by the routed traffic. So far, route pinning was the only known way of the stabilization. But, as RSVP merges multiple RESV messages to create a new one, pinned route computed elsewhere for different QoS requirement is not useful after the merge. That is, we need a sticky hop-by-hop QoS routing algorithm. Path QoS Collection is such an algorithm to collect true upstream link QoS in PATH messages to correct the link QoS information distributed by QoS routing protocols.
